update.description:
Adds a `self_collide` boolean to `model.sdf` that toggles model link collisions unless overridden by its child and grandchild elements.

[Gazebo implementation](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1480/implemented-self_collide-bool-for-model/diff)
update.title: Added self_collide element for model

content.raw: no, sorry, I just keep forgetting to mention that clause; I can add it. I don't intend to make implement collisions between links connected by a joint unless there's a strong push to do it.
content.html: no, sorry, I just keep forgetting to mention that clause; I can add it. I don't intend to make implement collisions between links connected by a joint unless there's a strong push to do it.

content.raw: To clarify, the plan is to make it possible for two links to collide even if they are connected by a joint?
content.html: To clarify, the plan is to make it possible for two links to collide even if they are connected by a joint?

content.raw:
Clause about links connected by joints?

Edit: Just read the next comment. Does that mean we will change gazebo's behavior?
content.html:
Clause about links connected by joints?

Edit: Just read the next comment. Does that mean we will change gazebo's behavior?

content.raw: Right, I did not realize until today that gazebo6 needs sdf 3. I'll retarget it
content.html: Right, I did not realize until today that gazebo6 needs sdf 3. I'll retarget it

content.raw: The gazebo pull request is going to the `default` branch, which will require sdformat 3.0, and the [jenkins job is showing troubles](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/29/). I think the solution is to retarget this to default and merge the branch with default, so that this branch provides the `collide_bitmask` field.
content.html: The gazebo pull request is going to the default branch, which will require sdformat 3.0, and the jenkins job is showing troubles. I think the solution is to retarget this to default and merge the branch with default, so that this branch provides the collide_bitmask field.

content.raw:
Well, this is how we have implemented the collision callbacks. We could generate contacts for these links.

We should add a comment that states not all links in a  model can collide.
content.html:
Well, this is how we have implemented the collision callbacks. We could generate contacts for these links.

We should add a comment that states not all links in a model can collide.

content.raw: This is how ODE currently works
All links except those connected by a joint.
